result.execSummary:
The defendant Makayla Nicole Katherine Marthaler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered. 
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Expungement granted upon successful completion of sentence.
Defendant shall have no contact with victim ACE unless approved by defendant's Probation Agent.

Restitution summary

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Makayla Nicole Katherine Marthaler in court and by Attorney Deborah Ann Strigenz. Counsel's first appearance. Resolution reached.  Joint recommendation.  State does not oppose expungement.  No contest pleas entered on Cts. 1, 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilt on Cts. 1, 2 and 3.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of sentence.
Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Notice of hearing for 8/17/22; not deliverable as addressed
Order on Petition for Appointment of Attorney; not deliverable as addressed

(Copy mailed to Defendant and Defendant's Attorney)
No contact with ACE or PE

Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Makayla Nicole Katherine Marthaler in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Makayla Nicole Katherine Marthaler. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def does not qualify for SPD and req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Strigenz.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $40 per month commencing 8-15-22.  Court sets $1000 signature bond and enters NG pleas on behalf of def.
Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
